newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Anam Industrial trades most actively.
newsitem.headline: Anam Industrial trades most actively.

text.p: Anam Industrial Corp's shares recorded Wednesday's largest trading volume in the Seoul bourse in anticipation of improving corporate earnings, brokers said.
Anam briefly hit a 1997 high of 14,000 won, but stood at 13,700 in the afternoon session, up 700 won.
A Tongyang Securities broker said investors believed Anam would post a handsome profit this year thanks to anticipated growing world demand for memory chips used in home electronics appliances.
An Anam official said turnover would increase to 1.4 trillion won in calendar 1997 from 1.1 trillion a year ago.
He said heavy investments to expand domestic facilities would worsen its profit this year, but gave no further details. The company posted 30 billion won in recurring profit last year.
A Sungkyong Securities broker attributed the price rise to hopes for an issue of global depositary receipts to help finance the facilities investment.
"Investors raised their expectations that the company would boost share prices ahead of the overseas bond issue," the Sunkyong Securities broker.
The company official denied that speculation.
